intro: Acinodendron denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed acinodendron, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with finely toothed margins. It produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a small capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
